alert.note: Alert for Breckinridge (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 03 at 7:25AM EST until March 03 at 10:15AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EST/930 AM CST/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Indiana and NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, in south central Indiana, Clark, Crawford, Dubois, Floyd, Harrison, Orange and Perry. In NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Breckinridge, Bullitt, Hardin, Jefferson and Meade. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM EST /930 AM CST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 725 AM EST /625 AM CST/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Louisville, Jeffersonville, New Albany, Jeffersontown, St. Matthews, Shively, Jasper, Shepherdsville, Lyndon and Tell City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
